Message:
​
a wild rumor that claims that the company is planning to use only Exynos chips in the Galaxy S25 series. This rumor also claims that Samsung will use Snapdragon chips only in the Galaxy Z series in 2025, while the Galaxy A series phones to be released that year will consist of Exynos and MediaTek chips.
The Exynos 2500 is expected to be impressive due to these four reasons:
Multiple reports have claimed that Samsung has created a separate team to optimize its next-generation in-house Exynos chip.
This time, the company is expected to have tailor-made its next Exynos chip for Galaxy phones.
The upcoming flagship Exynos chip will reportedly use Samsung Foundry's second-generation 3nm fabrication process.
The Cortex-X5 CPU core from Arm will reportedly be faster than CPUs in Apple's A/M series chips.
Exynos 2500 For the win!!

Message:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is getting this big upgrade that will significantly improve the smartphone user experience. Samsung will also include a much faster RAM on the Galaxy S25 Ultra. The Galaxy S25 Ultra will also get the much-needed design change.
​
It runs at 10.7Gbps, surpassing the 9.6Gbps LPDDR5T variant that was introduced by SK Hynix last year. This represents a 25% increase in performance over the previous X variants, but speed isn’t the only upgrade.
Samsung is building these chips on a 12nm class process, which means that the chips are smaller. This allowed the company to increase capacity by 30% and is now building 32GB packages with it.

Message:
You should think that apps are less optimized, so you need more memory because you can't control if the app is optimized, but all these are not up to Samsung to control. Samsung only controls oneUI memory management. The rest of the third-party app and Android system RAM usage is not really their problem.
Also, buying Apple doesn't mean 8GB is the same as 16GB. You will see when the apps become unoptimized, so you can't make it magically use less RAM.
For now, 12GB RAM is great for multitasking, running two games on split-screen, playing music, going on social media, etc. More than that, you probably are in desktop mode.

Message:
​
Samsung plans to mass produce the Exynos 2500 using the 3nm process and that the processor will appear in the Galaxy S25 series. The outlet adds that the Exynos 2500 may end up surpassing Qualcomm’s upcoming Snapdragon 8 Gen 4 chip, which is also expected to use a 3nm process.
But the trend tends to be that Qualcomm’s chip is more powerful, while Exynos is more power efficient. It appears this may continue to be the case as industry analysts predict “the Exynos 2500 will exhibit superior power efficiency compared to Qualcomm’s latest offerings.”

Message:
Samsung has already finalized the design of all three members of the Galaxy S25 family. The S25 Ultra is said to have an asymmetrical frame design to help with the grip.
Reportedly, the frame toward the back panel is more rounded to help with the grip, while the front will be straighter. This will also make the bezels look thinner, although we aren't exactly sure how that would be achieved. The handset's width will be retained, and the side frame will be narrower in general.

Message:
Yesterday, a leak showed off a
for the
, but we had to imagine the phone that is supposed to go inside. Now our imagination can be aided with photos and a video showing a dummy of the phone, courtesy of
xleaks7
and
Online Solitaire
.
The dimensions of the S25 Ultra are written on the front of the dummy: 162.82 x 77.65 x 8.25mm. For comparison, the S24 Ultra measures 162.3 x 79.0 x 8.6mm and weighs 232g. Now, the dummy can’t tell us the weight of the new Ultra, but
Ice Universe
puts it at 219g. So, the new phone is a fraction of a millimeter taller, but over a millimeter narrower, a bit thinner and noticeably lighter.

Message:
Personal experience here. been using a D9300+ iQOO phone for months, before that was using another iQOO phone with SD8Gen3 and before that another SD8Gen3 phone from Redmi for months. All 3 got the same 5,000mAh and similar specs, and I didn't notice any massive difference in battery life in day to day use, as well as playing demanding games. My experience with the D9300+ phone is basically same as the SD8Gen3 phones. Not saying completely won't have difference for everyone, since there might be apps/games (emulators) that are more optimised for Snapdragon, but I think for most ppl, probably won't be able to tell the difference. D9400 so far in early hands on looks super impressive, especially power efficiency and performance. Not sure how it will stack up against the upcoming Snapdragon, but no matter what it probably wouldn't be a bad experience, and probably will be better than whatever Samsung can cook up with Exynos. not that don't want Samsung fab to do well, but at this point not much faith in them...
and it's not even a recent thing that MTK chips has been good. Their Dimensity series has been decent since it started years ago (have tested 1200 back then), and a while back 8100 was such a great chip. Back then when i was testing OnePlus 10R, it performed better than flagship phones I was testing (OPPO Find X5 Pro, vivo X80 Pro) using Snapdragon 8Gen1 in games like Genshin, simply because 8Gen1 heated up so quickly that they have to throttle it really hard. So really hoping that the rumour that Samsung will use MTK chip for S25 is true. Even if not, I hope they will use the D9400 in other series like the FE, or maybe even a higher end A series.

Message:
you're probably paying attention to the wrong number on the graph. it can use up to 18W of power draw doesn't mean it WILL draw 18W. it's just the upper limit the chip is capable of, and it's that high because when geekerwan, etc do their tests, they root the phone and manually set the CPU clocks to test it. In actual day to day use, the phone will probably never use 18W of power, and will likely not need to considering they can achieve most of the performance with just half that. so no sane manufacturer will let the chip run at its upper limit. even in situation where they use more power to speed up a task, like fast camera processing, fast app launching, etc, it will be a burst of power before reverting to lower clocks.
even when playing graphically intensive games like genshin, hsr, zzz, geekerwan test indicates around 4-6W of combined CPU+GPU power draw. in day to day usage the powerdraw will be even lower. and if you look at those low-mid power draw, the chip is noticeably better than D9300 and SD8G3, and can almost match Apple's A18 Pro. this is just CPU, and GPU is even more impressive.
and if you just look at all the reviews there, almost every review I've seen for vivo X200 series didn't mention any heat or battery concerns. all saying noticeable improvement in battery life and great performance and efficiency. just on geekerwan's in depth analysis should be able to tell how impressed they are with it. if got issue, they confirm will highlight like they did with their 888 and 8Gen1 analysis at launch.

Message:
Nowadays still got people renewing their contract? Not unless your contract can get you a line at below $20/mth. Get a sim only plans and buy the phone off contract will save you even more in the long run. Best if you buy the s25 in a couple months time.
I don't think the batteries are all bad in the s25 line up. Is just not the best comparing some other brands out there. Yet it is no where worse than some other brands out there.
Gpay or Samsung Pay is up to you to decide. You can use both in Samsung phones any way. Like I do use Gpay for transport as it is working and instant than Spay (no embarrassing hogged up). While I use Spay for all my daily spending. Apart from that Gpay has Paynow function.
Edit: apart from that. Camera wise I feel that Samsung and Pixel have pretty much consistently hit or nail every shot properly. I feel that Vivo and Oppo consistency in every shot can be a miss sometimes though. My personal take on them is that I prefer the output and consistency of Samsungs photo.

Message:
Since my corporate phone allowance is through claims, I subscribed to the $120 Singtel plan and only paid around $500+ for the S23U. I plan to do the same for this recontract.
Samsung’s 5000mAh battery is decent, but the charging speed feels way too slow. Even though it lasts, phones with bigger battery capacities might drain faster, but they have more overall capacity to work with. Personally, I’d be happy if Samsung bumped it up to 5500mAh—though I’m not expecting 6000mAh—and improved charging speeds to at least 65W. Just my two cents.
I’ve also got a Samsung Watch and mostly use it for payments, including daily expenses and transport. My wife, on the other hand, uses a Samsung Watch paired with an Honor phone. It works with Samsung Pay using some workarounds, but adding new cards is such a hassle. It feels like there’s no perfect solution.
As for the camera, Samsung’s cameras are always impressive at launch, but after a few firmware updates, I feel like the quality on my S23U has dropped. I even compared photos from when it first launched to now, and the difference is noticeable. Maybe it’s part of their business strategy? On the other hand, the photo quality from the Vivo X200 Pro and Magic 7 Pro looks pretty stunning.
Cleaned_Message: since corporate phone allowance claims subscribed 120 singtel plan paid around 500 s23u plan recontract samsungs 50mah battery decent charging speed feels way slow even though lasts phones bigger battery capacities might drain faster overall capacity work personally id happy samsung bumped 50mahthough im not expecting 60mahand improved charging speeds least 65w two cents ive also got samsung watch mostly use payments including daily expenses transport wife hand uses samsung watch paired honor phone works samsung pay using workarounds adding new cards hassle feels like theres no perfect solution camera samsungs cameras always impressive launch firmware updates feel like quality s23u dropped even compared photos first launched difference noticeable maybe part business strategy hand photo quality vivo x20 pro magic 7 pro looks pretty stunning

Message:
I mean if you decided to be in the coy for long then ok lah. If you not in the coy for long and let's say you quit. Does the line continues to be under your care? If so I don't see how reducing the monthly fees should still be beneficial to you. Any way I leave it to you to decide on that.
Battery won't be increasing anytime soon. From the experience that they have when they blew up all the note 7, I'm sure they are taking a slow approach on the battery dept. Outsourcing of battery design to outsiders to do the battery for them also comes with a risk. Just like apple also till today they never increase charging speed, I'm sure they have their reasons.
As for upgrades of software. Ok leh. I don't see much of a difference in camera since launch and almost a year with the s24 now.
But hey man, I'm not here to convince u to buy the s25. Is really up to you. If you feel comfortable with other brands, then by all means man.
Cleaned_Message: mean decided coy long ok lah not coy long let us say quit line continues care not see reducing monthly fees still beneficial way leave decide battery not increasing anytime soon experience blew note 7 sure taking slow approach battery dept outsourcing battery design outsiders battery also comes risk like apple also till today never increase charging speed sure reasons upgrades software ok leh not see much difference camera since launch almost year s24 hey man not convince u buy s25 really feel comfortable brands means man

Message:
No worries at all, I get where you’re coming from.
I’m just in a bit of a dilemma. My S23U is still holding up well for daily use, but when I’m traveling and constantly taking photos, I wish the battery could last longer. I always have to bring a power bank, whereas my wife’s Honor Magic6 Pro easily lasts the whole day without much worry.
Now that my contract is up for renewal, I’ve got to decide between the Samsung S25U, Oppo Find N5, Vivo X200 Pro, or Honor Magic 7 Pro. Honestly, I have no idea what to go for. I lean towards the S25U because of the OS and ecosystem—it feels reliable and familiar—but it’s starting to feel a bit boring with no surprises anymore. For the others, I’m concerned about their OS since a few minutes of testing in a showroom doesn’t really give me enough to go on. Life is complicated especially someone have Decision paralysis like me!
Cleaned_Message: no worries get youre coming im bit dilemma s23u still holding well daily use im traveling constantly taking photos wish battery could last longer always bring power bank whereas wifes honor magic6 pro easily lasts whole day without much worry contract renewal ive got decide samsung s25u opo find n5 vivo x20 pro honor magic 7 pro honestly no idea go lean towards s25u os ecosystemit feels reliable familiarbut starting feel bit boring no surprises anymore others im concerned os since minutes testing showroom doesnt really give enough go life complicated especially someone decision paralysis like

Message:
Woah finally have someone like me. Thanks for sharing your frustration. I have been fretting over this for the entire afternoon till I cannot focus at work.
Yeah sentiments as u, I literally told the CSO off.. I might as well keep my money. CSO is offering a $150 off voucher with free Care+, but no additional vouchers are allowed to be stacked. Then what's the point of me purchasing the $10 e voucher.. same like me I am ok to forgo it.. but don't expect me to buy this S25 Ultra. He final questioned me if I wanted the voucher. I said no.. he just said that he respected my decision to not buy. Yeah I understand that CSO don't make any money from this, but shouldn't they at least investigate this.. I made sure not to purchase the voucher from the app itself and purchased from my Web browser and the Web browser also didn't display the 10% discount banner at the cart,so it was not possible that it triggered the purchase from app.
First time I experienced such trouble to purchase a phone. I felt outright cheated into purchasing the voucher because I had to go thru their cart and they made use of this opportunity to regard it as my first purchase, regardless of the platform I used. So, anyone who wants to purchase the $10 voucher must lose the 10% discount.. the 10% discount is not a small amount..  it is $182.80 off $1828. If they are not willing to give such discount, just don't advertise it. I don't care about it. If they advertise, I expect them to honour it. We consumers are not dumb.. we know clearly what we are doing to achieve the discount.
So, I fully understand how u are feeling right now. I have spent the past 5 hours trying to log out and log in the Shop app in hope of a miracle, but alas no. If no 10% discount, I will skip this purchase. Anyway, this isn't a big upgrade to me, as I am using Z Fold 3 now. The only issue I am facing for my Z Fold 3 is the battery, other than that, I am enjoying the big inner screen and watching videos without any camera hole. The under display camera although not fully transparent, but it's good enough.
Cleaned_Message: woah finally someone like thanks sharing frustration fretting entire afternoon till not focus work yeah sentiments u literally told cso might well keep money cso offering 150 voucher free care no additional vouchers allowed stacked point purchasing 10 e voucher like ok forgo not expect buy s25 ultra final questioned wanted voucher said no said respected decision not buy yeah understand cso not make money not least investigate made sure not purchase voucher ap purchased web browser web browser also not display 10 discount banner cartso not possible triggered purchase ap first time experienced trouble purchase phone felt outright cheated purchasing voucher go thru cart made use opportunity regard first purchase regardless platform used anyone wants purchase 10 voucher must lose 10 discount 10 discount not small amount 18280 1828 not willing give discount not advertise not care advertise expect honour consumers not dumb know clearly achieve discount fully understand u feeling right spent past 5 hours trying log log shop ap hope miracle alas no no 10 discount skip purchase anyway not big upgrade using z fold 3 issue facing z fold 3 battery enjoying big inner screen watching videos without camera hole display camera although not fully transparent good enough

Message:
Section 4: Payment
4.1 Under what circumstance will there be a clawback of the Trade-In Value and overtrade bonus (if any) to my credit card?
These are the circumstances where there will be a chargeback of the Trade-in Value and overtrade bonus (if any) to your credit card:
• Unsuccessful trade-in
• Your rejection of the Adjusted Offer and where the trade-in process is not completed with the Trade-in Vendor
• Trade-in Vendor unable to collect your Trade-in Device during a second collection attempt.
• Device IMEI or serial number varies from your declaration and you are unable to surrender the correct Trade-in Device.
• Customer refuses to provide NRIC details to Trade-in Vendor at point of collection
• Device has already been committed for trade-in with other trade-in partners of Samsung (e.g. offline trade-in partner, PC Dreams)
• Device has defects which renders it not eligible for trade-in (please refer to FAQ 3.4 above).
• Device is stolen

Message:
Found the answer, not sure if 100% correct.
AI Overview
No, a Bluetooth S Pen from an S24 Ultra will not work with an S25 Ultra because the S25 Ultra's S Pen lacks Bluetooth functionality, meaning it cannot utilize the air gestures and remote control features that the S24 Ultra's S Pen offers with its Bluetooth capabilities; you can only use the basic stylus functions on the S25 Ultra with the S24 Ultra S Pen.
Key points to remember:
S25 Ultra S Pen has no Bluetooth:
Samsung has removed Bluetooth functionality from the S Pen on the S25 Ultra.

Limited functionality:
This means you can't use air gestures or remote control features with the S24 Ultra S Pen on the S25 Ultra.

Basic stylus functions still work:
However, the S24 Ultra S Pen will still function as a basic stylus for writing and drawing on the S25 Ultra screen

Message:
Was using S21U and S22U before jumping from S23U to ZF6.
I lose out on camera quality but gain in screen size and better selfie shots.
Personally what stopped me from making the change from S23U to S24U was the x10 optical zoom drop to x5.
I'm still keeping tabs on S Ultra series bcoz it's my interest.
Just my 2 cents worth of personal opinion -
Design - I like S25U or more rather I like the design since S22U days and I think it's good for them to continue with this trend. Afterall, iPhone can do it so why shouldn't Samsung?
Processor and software - I gotta hand it to Samsung for being the front runners in these 2 department from S23 series onwards. S21 and S22 series was really bad to be honest. I feel that they are currently 1 of the better android companies for now. It's a shame Huawei isn't around to give them a run for their money due to politics.
Camera - Every other companies are determined to make their cameras better and better by leaps and bounds with every new release but shockingly S25U took a turn for the worst. Enough said.
S pen - What can I say? Go big on AI and go back to stone age on S pen? It's one of their USP and they decided to uturn and stupidfy it? There are surely better ways to cut cost and this definitely shouldn't be the way to do it.
Overall conclusion for me - I will wait for ZF7 and/or a better camera phone (android based) for 2025.
Congrats in advance and hope you guys enjoy your new toys and do give your feedbacks once you've played with it!!

Message:
Don't think that will be happening and all hopes dashed. Samsung mentioned that post was a mistake:
(Latest update from androidauthority)
Samsung confirms Galaxy S25 Ultra Bluetooth S Pen tease was a mistake​
Galaxy S25 Ultra won't support Bluetooth S Pen after all, despite Samsung's recent blog post.
Last week, Samsung published a blog post about Galaxy S25 Ultra S Pen productivity.

That post included a passage referencing the phone’s support for Bluetooth-equipped S Pen accessories, contrary to Samsung’s earlier comments.

Samsung now clarifies that this post was in error, and the S25 Ultra does not support any Bluetooth S Pen interactions.

Understandably, we reached out to Samsung for comment, and have now heard back from the S25 manufacturer. Sadly, this blog post appears to have just been an erroneous tease, and Samsung confirms that the S25 Ultra will
not
support S Pen Bluetooth controls no matter which S Pen you use it with.

Message:
For my case, I have a S22U and S22+, both with pink lines. And I don't think it's anything to do with 60/120Hz refresh. It's just poor quality.
I emailed and called Samsung about this and provided a strong case. Asked them to repair my device with the nominal labor fee of $54. They escalated this. After approval with their management, they asked me to select a service centre.
They will inspect your phone and you WILL need to wipe your device. They mention 1-2 weeks, but the phone was ready in 1 day. If your phone has any signs of drops (dings, dents, etc) they will reject it. So do backup your data in advance, but don't do a factory reset until they actually accept the phone.
One interesting thing is that they don't seem to change the screen only. It seems to come with the frame as well. So basically you get a new glass and frame.
Standard prices for Ultra screens is about $400+ and non-Ultra is about $200+. Might as well change it outside if it comes to this.
Cleaned_Message: case s2u s2 pink lines not think anything 60120hz refresh poor quality emailed called samsung provided strong case asked repair device nominal labor fee 54 escalated approval management asked select service centre inspect phone need wipe device mention 12 weeks phone ready 1 day phone signs drops dings dents etc reject backup data advance not factory reset actually accept phone one interesting thing not seem change screen seems come frame well basically get new glass frame standard prices ultra screens 400 nonultra 200 might well change outside comes

Message:
Personally, any film protectors just do not last long. 6mths of normal usage and I get tired of looking at the micro-scratches.
For glass, I can easily tahan a year and beyond.
Thus, $38 is ridiculous. I've posted a link to Anvers AR film, which costs 8 bucks, and Im curious how it fares. Whitestone which sells sells their over-priced UV glass is now selling AR glass. Also pricey, but I figured with Samsung going all flat, they're gonna loose business.. haha. Still, worth trying out.
My Ugreen is arriving today. The AR effect is probably 60-70%, and so far I'm ok with that, esp with Spigen which is probably 0% AR, 100% mirror
So.. I just find this whole SP business is about branding. There are some really good protectors which are cheap, and some really expensive ones which are meh. Samsung at 38? Definitely overpriced. If they have  2-pack for the same price, I'd get it, so I can swap out every 6mths.
Cleaned_Message: personally film protectors not last long 6mths normal usage get tired looking microscratches glass easily tahan year beyond thus 38 ridiculous posted link anvers ar film costs 8 bucks im curious fares whitestone sells sells overpriced uv glass selling ar glass also pricey figured samsung going flat gon na loose business haha still worth trying ugren arriving today ar effect probably 6070 far ok esp spigen probably 0 ar 100 mirror find whole sp business branding really good protectors cheap really expensive ones meh samsung 38 definitely overpriced 2pack price would get swap every 6mths

Message:
If follow that theory yes. But risk is the trade in value might be reduced in the event that your handset gets delayed.
The trade in prices you get based on this route is based on the day you bring your device in for trade in. This is unlike trading in during the purchase where the value is offset immediately.
Based on current trade in prices, the prices given by the 2nd vendor which handles the "offline" trade in is higher.

Message:
I don't (at least not yet) intend to jump on their ecosystem.
Just phone. I've had enough devices from both sides to say that in terms of customer support (be it standard or paid) or in terms of using it daily my own exp with fruit has been noticably if not miles better.
And frankly even ecosystem wise there are things they do that( while not like cannot live without) that no one else does (well enough) (doorbell notification coming in via apple tv? Even Home assistant you'll be hard pressed to get it; apple homekey etc)
Then there's the software support, and ease of getting it cheaply repaired. I think that's the other two factor why I didn't switch to oppo or vivo or OnePlus.
All to say I don't think Samsung is atrocious. Just my own exp with them esp of late not very favourable and I was already looking to maybe switch out. Their software support and general popularity (which typically = better availability of spare parts + repairs) is what kept me on board (cause I intend for this to last at least 5-7 years)
Cleaned_Message: not least not yet intend jump ecosystem phone enough devices sides say terms customer support standard paid terms using daily exp fruit noticably not miles better frankly even ecosystem wise things not like not live without no one else well enough doorbell notification coming via apple tv even home assistant hard pressed get apple homekey etc software support ease getting cheaply repaired think two factor not switch opo vivo oneplus say not think samsung atrocious exp esp late not favourable already looking maybe switch software support general popularity typically better availability spare parts repairs kept board cause intend last least 57 years

Message:
Collected S25U from Singtel. Anyone know why Singtel has to open the box (not an issue) to boot up the phone?
The salesperson told me need to connect to their shop wifi to activate warranty. I mentioned that if it's warranty I want to do it so that it's linked to my Samsung account so I do not want them to do it wrongly. In the end they insisted until they reached the samsung update page in the phone and said its completed. Seems like they received instructions to do until this step. But to my knowledge this is BS as I don't think the warranty is activated this way. Feel free to correct me.
While I understand that the email states that the phone needs to be inspected at the shop, I am totally fine if you just open up the box and see the phone physically. Now the initial SP sticker is peeled.. to which I can't slap on a TGSP immediately so that chances of having dust in between is slimmer.. I also have to factory reset the phone because the initial boot up was done in a way that the salesperson has allowed all the google permissions.
Going forward I will try to insist to collect as a collection point instead of Singtel retail shop. I can wait a couple more days no issue.
Cleaned_Message: collected s25u singtel anyone know singtel open box not issue boot phone salesperson told need connect shop wifi activate warranty mentioned warranty want linked samsung account not want wrongly end insisted reached samsung update page phone said completed seems like received instructions step knowledge bs not think warranty activated way feel free correct understand email states phone needs inspected shop totally fine open box see phone physically initial sp sticker peeled not slap tgsp immediately chances dust slimmer also factory reset phone initial boot done way salesperson allowed google permissions going forward try insist collect collection point instead singtel retail shop wait couple days no issue

Message:
Quick review on the Ugreen SP (standard no-border):
1. Edges sit on the black bezel. Means it's case friendly, yet theres no rainbow effect as it's beyond the edge of the OLED.
2. AR-ness is not too bad. Of course it is not rated as an AR glass, but it's definitely not a mirror like Spigen. If you're familiar with the S24U glass, it is exactly like that
3. Oleophobic coating is also good, again, exactly like the S24U one. Note that the coating will wear out over time. I will be replacing the S24U SP before handing it over to wife. SP been in use for about 11mths.
3. FP sensing works great for me, but only after re-registering.
Overall, I'm happy. No complains, esp for something <$5 per piece. If there's a SOLID choice for a proper AR glass without breaking the bank, I don't mind trying. Curious about the SmartDevil one. Need more reviews on that.
cc:
@kashix
Cleaned_Message: quick review ugren sp standard noborder 1 edges sit black bezel means case friendly yet theres no rainbow effect beyond edge oled 2 arnes not bad course not rated ar glass definitely not mirror like spigen familiar s24u glass exactly like 3 oleophobic coating also good exactly like s24u one note coating wear time replacing s24u sp handing wife sp use 1mths 3 fp sensing works great reregistering overall happy no complains esp something 5 per piece solid choice proper ar glass without breaking bank not mind trying curious smartdevil one need reviews cc kashix

Message:
I overcame the whatsapp transfer issue this way and I think its the fastest and easiet way.
1. Connect an SSD drive to old device.
2. Use file explorer app to go to Android->Media folder to look for the Whatsapp folder.
3. Copy that entire whatsapp folder to the SSD drive
4. Once done, connect SSD drive to new device and copy the whatsapp folder back to same location in new device.
5. Install Whatsapp in new device. Run it and it will detect the folder data and restore everything according. All chats and associated media.
You can do the same above using PC by connecting devices to PC.

Someone was asking me about the spigen frosted casing sometime ago....so here's my comment- the case is stunning...because of the frosted black, it creates a nice metallic grey / light blue tint to it. The casing also fits well with the ugreen privacy tempered glass.
However one negative- i think the corner of the casing where the spen is a big risk. Spigen has cut it too wide and too lean.  Hence that corner becomes vulnerable if you drop your phone at that exact corner, it's gonna be gg. Your spen and corner will get scratch.
I will probably change another casing soon.....personally corners are the ones which get damaged easily when we drop our phones hence I am not going to take this risk.

Message:
Actually yes and no la.
I figured out if you are willing to buy the phone without even seeing, you actually potentially can get a better deal.
Why so.... From the public store.
1828
Less $88 pre launch coupon
Less $40 (prepay $10 get $50 promo)
Less $50 Citi Credit Card discount
Less 10% new Samsung Shop App first time user
Less Samsung bonus points worth $100
You are paying 1386.
Some may have also successfully applied HUAT38 and free 2 years Care Plus...
If you have Shopback, day 1 purchase price is about high 1.2k which is actually considered a good deal.
If you fall into the group who only order from day 3 onwards, yes, you really potentially have paid more for the phone.
The way Samsung does its pre launch needs to be rethought though i feel. The dishing out lf new promotions to stack on existing pre launch deals in the middle of the promotoion creates negative publicity in a way.

Message:
FYI
Those who want's to port your WhatsApp chats ONLY (no media)
Just need to perform a local backup.
The file which you need to move over is:
Android > Media > Com.Whatsapp > Whatsapp > Databases > msgstore.db.crypt14
This would typically be the newest file in the directory. Just need to copy this over, instead of the gigs of data.
I also moved my stickers too (not sure required or not)
Android > Media > Com.Whatsapp > Whatsapp > Backups (folder)
Cleaned_Message: fyi wants port whatsap chats no media need perform local backup file need move android media comwhatsap whatsap databases msgstoredbcrypt14 would typically newest file directory need copy instead gigs data also moved stickers not sure required not android media comwhatsap whatsap backups folder

Message:
Just a few days of usage. I can safely say I like
- oneui7 more.
- The 50Mp ultrawide double down as a macro is top notch.
- The 5G signal is a lot more responsive and stays well signal.
- The ai select is a lot more intuitive than just circle to search.
- The phone is surprisingly well balanced to hold and light.
- The processor is blazing fast. The ai editing, the short video editing blaze through the process. I have never felt such fast processor for the longest time.
What I do not like....
- TikTok is buggy, make me miss some labubu live drops. Lol
- The initial battery drain is serious due to usage learning.
- Gemini is still a hit or miss for my daily usage with home automations
- The 50Mp tele is still muddy. By now Samsung should have tweaked the software since s24 era. But not much have changed.
Cleaned_Message: days usage safely say like oneui7 50mp ultrawide double macro top notch 5g signal lot responsive stays well signal ai select lot intuitive circle search phone surprisingly well balanced hold light processor blazing fast ai editing short video editing blaze process never felt fast processor longest time not like tiktok buggy make miss labubu live drops lol initial battery drain serious due usage learning gemini still hit miss daily usage home automations 50mp tele still muddy samsung tweaked software since s24 era not much changed

Message:
Been using S25U for a few days. From fold 6
Summary
1. Blazing fast
2. Battery way better than fold 6. Everyday worried about battery for fold 6. So different
3. AI is faster but TBH won't be using it everyday.
4. Love the anti reflections screen. Hopefully fold 7 come with it.
5. Screen tooo small. Used to fold big screen.
6. One ui not working with well with intune. Widget app not working after installing intune. Same in my S9 ultra. But widget working on nova launcher.
7. The build is premium, camera also as compared with fold 6. But very slippery. I used it naked.
Cheers

Message:
my guess is to avoid heating up the phone too much for too long. i'm not sure 100% but i suspect mostly happening due to heat dmg to some component on the screen. a lot of report is after software update lines show up, but that is likely just because phone will heat up a lot during update, and sometimes phone will check for updates when is connected to power, and charging will cause more heat. then some folks also like using more protective cases which means thicker and trap heat, and some folks might leave their phone on bed/sofa while phone is charging, which traps even more heat. my sister has a xiaomi 11t pro which got the greenline after a software update exactly because of these circumstances. she said phone was very very hot after update, then green line showed up after that.
also, it's likely that older phones might be more prone to this since their heat dissipation usually not as good, plus some of the older generation chips tend to run quite hot to begin with. and could be some older OLED panels are just more susceptible to such dmg. newer phones might fare better. then the other possibility could be drop dmg too if somehow enough force to dmg in internal screen components. even if use a case, some of the force might pass through the phone too.
personally, i just have a small usb/battery powered fan on my desk that i use to blow at the phone when gaming, charging, or just doing software update. cheap and effective at keeping the phone cool. even if end up green line isn't due to heat, reducing heat will still be better for other internal components like battery/processor in the long run too. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
Cleaned_Message: guess avoid heating phone much long not sure 100 suspect mostly happening due heat dmg component screen lot report software update lines show likely phone heat lot update sometimes phone check updates connected power charging cause heat folks also like using protective cases means thicker trap heat folks might leave phone bedsofa phone charging traps even heat sister xiaomi 1t pro got grenline software update exactly circumstances said phone hot update green line showed also likely older phones might prone since heat dissipation usually not good plus older generation chips tend run quite hot begin could older oled panels susceptible dmg newer phones might fare better possibility could drop dmg somehow enough force dmg internal screen components even use case force might pass phone personally small usbatery powered fan desk use blow phone gaming charging software update cheap effective keeping phone cool even end green line not due heat reducing heat still better internal components like bateryprocesor long run \_

Message:
Apple PO iirc usually is give you a range, like deliver between Date A and Date B. Usually ETA is accurate one, and sometimes earlier. Samsung is just say "ships
from
" this date onwards... with no "ship
by
" date. So even if they ship few months later, technically still "on time".
then you have their extra long refund process also if you do give up. totally different experience. In recent years their resale value seems to have gotten better and more comparable to iPhones liao which is nice, but then in other areas, they still got a lot of room for improvements.
This. i actually ordered the AR film protector after i did the phone. separate from my phone order. that one was packed almost immediately and got the item like
2 days
later from SF express. So don't feel like it's a delivery issue to me as well.
just checked and it's actually more like 1 day since i ordered after midnight. that day packed and collected by SF, next day delivered liao.

Message:
The Best Samsung Galaxy S25 Cases and Accessories
​
You just spent a lot of money on a new Samsung phone. Keep it safe with these cases and screen protectors.
Best Screen Protector
​
dbrand Prism 2.0 Tempered Glass Screen Protector (2 Pack)
I think ESR's
is better value (see further below), but it's only available for the Galaxy S25 Ultra right now. Dbrand's Prism 2.0 tempered glass protector is just as great and is available for all three S25 devices, though it's a two-pack and more expensive. It comes with an alcohol wipe to clean the screen and a microfiber cloth to wipe it down. (Dust removal stickers would have been nice.) Once that's done, place the plastic applicator over the phone's screen and pull the tab. The application is perfect, and I had zero air bubbles to deal with.
Remember, with almost every screen protector you install, you need to re-add your fingerprints for the biometric authentication to work. To do this, head to
Settings > Security and privacy > Screen lock and biometrics > Fingerprints > Add fingerprint
. You can also increase the screen's touch sensitivity by going to
Settings > Display > Touch sensitivity
.
Cleaned_Message: best samsung galaxy s25 cases accessories spent lot money new samsung phone keep safe cases screen protectors best screen protector dbrand prism 20 tempered glass screen protector 2 pack think esrs better value see available galaxy s25 ultra right dbrands prism 20 tempered glass protector great available three s25 devices though twopack expensive comes alcohol wipe clean screen microfiber cloth wipe dust removal stickers would nice done place plastic applicator phones screen pull tab application perfect zero air bubbles deal remember almost every screen protector install need read fingerprints biometric authentication work head settings security privacy screen lock biometrics fingerprints add fingerprint also increase screens touch sensitivity going settings display touch sensitivity

Message:
Some observation S24U vs S25U
1) Display is warmer, had to dial down vividness to get back the right whitebalance
2) Alot of notifications is not vibrating/notified. Need to learn to see how to get the old icon stack back on AOD.
3) Samsung film protector is easy to install. Has the same purple tint, but absolutely reducing the lux reflection as compared to Spigen or Ugreen. Seriously encourage people not to use glass SP now as you are really killing the main selling point of the phone, which is your screen.
4) Didnt had issue with whatsapp restore. Thought its common issue, but just did it and seem to restore ok
5) The left swipe right swipe separation very irritating. Anyway to set it back to old style?
Cleaned_Message: observation s24u vs s25u 1 display warmer dial vividness get back right whitebalance 2 alot notifications not vibratingnotified need learn see get old icon stack back aod 3 samsung film protector easy install purple tint absolutely reducing lux reflection compared spigen ugren seriously encourage people not use glass sp really killing main selling point phone screen 4 didnt issue whatsap restore thought common issue seem restore ok 5 left swipe right swipe separation irritating anyway set back old style

Message:
I don't deny that we accepted the terms at the point of purchase.
But the lack of transparency and how the promotions and its sequence of running the campaign did not take into consideration on the conglomerate image is amateurish.
The reason most of us still continue to buy Samsung mobile is due to the brand name. It is no longer their innovation or the lack of it now.
Flip flopping the promotion mechanism within the the same promotion period (pre-order) would cause discontentment and do you think Samsung is unaware? Moving forward to next year, I'll not be considering Samsung again but u can imagine those who buy the phone immediately after the announcement day having a worst deal than those who buys it days later within the pre-order period.
Have they grown too big to be able to dominate the market or simply take advantage of Singapore non return policy as compared to US?
For now, it's just me who trade in my S22 series, if they decided to extend up to perhaps S24 series, this thread will only be on what action we need to take against Samsung and nothing else.
Cleaned_Message: not deny accepted terms point purchase lack transparency promotions sequence running campaign not take consideration conglomerate image amateurish reason us still continue buy samsung mobile due brand name no longer innovation lack flip flopping promotion mechanism within promotion period preorder would cause discontentment think samsung unaware moving forward next year not considering samsung u imagine buy phone immediately announcement day worst deal buys days later within preorder period grown big able dominate market simply take advantage singapore non return policy compared us trade s2 series decided extend perhaps s24 series thread action need take samsung nothing else

Message:
portions of the consumer fair trading act ,

Relation to other remedies, etc.

17.
—(1)  If the transferee requires the transferor to repair or replace the goods, the transferee must not act under subsection (2) until the transferee has given the transferor a reasonable time in which to repair or replace (as the case may be) the goods.
[7/2012]

(2)  The transferee acts under this subsection if —

(
a
)
the transferee rejects the goods and terminates the contract for breach of condition; or
(
b
)
the transferee requires the goods to be repaired or replaced, as the case may be.
Cleaned_Message: portions consumer fair trading act relation remedies etc 17 1 transferee requires transferor repair replace goods transferee must not act subsection 2 transferee given transferor reasonable time repair replace case may goods [ 72012 ] 2 transferee acts subsection transferee rejects goods terminates contract breach condition b transferee requires goods repaired replaced case may

Message:
S25U 512GB Titanium JetBlack - Ordering Adventure
Ordered on Samsung Website: 27 Jan (Initial Delivery Schedule: 19 Feb)

Preparing Order to Awaiting Dispatch: Changed Delivery Schedule: 5 Feb

Went back to Preparing Order on 5 Feb

10 Feb contacted CS via Samsung Chat to enquire about status

10 Feb afternoon changed to Awaiting Dispatch

11 Feb afternoon changed to Out for Delivery (Email received)

12 Feb 0045hrs Delivery SMS received (Delivery between 1400-1800hrs)

12 Feb 1100hrs received package at home
Cleaned_Message: s25u 512gb titanium jetblack ordering adventure ordered samsung website 27 jan initial delivery schedule 19 feb preparing order awaiting dispatch changed delivery schedule 5 feb went back preparing order 5 feb 10 feb contacted cs via samsung chat enquire status 10 feb afternoon changed awaiting dispatch 11 feb afternoon changed delivery email received 12 feb 045hrs delivery sms received delivery 140180hrs 12 feb 10hrs received package home

Message:
Galaxy S25 Series, All-time Pre-booking Sales Gust and Market Analysis
• The recently released Samsung Galaxy S25 series broke the record in the history of the Galaxy S series with pre-order sales of 1.3 million units, exceeding the previous S24 series (1.21 million units), and it is a very successful result even considering the extension of the pre-order period.
• The sales ratio by model was 52% for Galaxy S25 Ultra, 26% for basic type, and 22% for plus, which is characterized by a decrease in the proportion of ultra models compared to the previous model (60%) and an increase in the proportion of basic and plus types. This is analyzed as the main reason for the disappearance of the RAM capacity differentiation of the plus model and the same Snapdragon 8 elite processor in all models of the S25 series.
• The 12-month sales of the Galaxy S25 series are expected to reach more than 40 million units, but this may vary not only depending on the pre-booking results but also on future domestic and foreign market sales and overseas consumer responses. In particular, there is a possibility that the response in overseas markets will be different from that in Korea, so there is uncertainty in predicting final sales.
• According to Hana Securities Research, sales of the Galaxy S24 series rose 19% from its predecessor to 37.17 million units, recovering to the level of the S10 series after the S20 series, which is analyzed as a result of positive factors such as performance improvement and price freezing, and this positive atmosphere seems to have contributed to the success of the S25 series.

Message:
Check
if you bought a phone from Samsung Online Store/Samsung Official Store on Lazada and Shopee/SES etc.
Scroll all the way down, you should see a link to do trade in online. Click on it, fill up the form based on the model you purchased and the model you have to trade in.
You will need to wait for your orders to be shipped as they will need your invoice and a photo of your device displaying the IMEI number.
Once this is submitted, they will process your request and WhatsApp/SMS you once your details are confirm.
If you didnt buy a phone from the qualifying platform, you can trigger them by going down to their shop. They still offer good prices even without the overtrade (not the highest though)

Message:
finish
liao since not much to say anyway hahaha. it's pretty much just S24 with better chip. conclusion is that with promo, good enough value for money because of SD8 elite, software (oneUI and longer software support), and their better than average resale value compared to other android phones. SD8 Elite can overcome some of the small phone shortcomings like poorer heat dissipation and small battery, but not all. While FPS does seems smoother when maxed out graphics compared to last gen flagship phones, S25 will still heat up more quickly unless lower some graphic settings in demanding games, which results in some thermal throttling. I would say overall gaming experience is perhaps just slightly better than a big screen well-cooled SD8Gen3 phone? Being more power efficient also means 4,000mAh feels more like a 5,000mAh SD8Gen3 phone... but definitely nowhere near the current gen monsters with SD8Elite + over 6000mAh. then again, the selling point of S25 is probable the size and weight which is unmatched. it's smaller and lighter a bit then S24 and iPhone 16, and it's one round smaller than other supposed "mini" phones like xiaomi 15 and vivo x200 pro mini. so still got some appeal there.
Screen wise like i suspect earlier after testing many phone, my trigger point is low frequency PWM at very low brightness and high frequency PWM at normal brightness and above. like iQOO phones tend to like to use 2160Hz PWM dimming which sounds nice on paper, but in higher brightness it's super triggering for me. Within seconds will feel strain on my eyes. So the 480Hz PWM actually ended up being okay for me, BUT only if i set the brightness level high enough. hard to explain in words... but if too low, the way the screen behave does cause noticeable eyestrain too. I can combat this using the "extra dim" option, but that comes with its own issues too which was why eventually i gave up on the phone too (also got other things that are less to do with samsung themselves, but rather google's app). lol.
Cleaned_Message: finish liao since not much say anyway hahaha pretty much s24 better chip conclusion promo good enough value money sd8 elite software oneui longer software support better average resale value compared android phones sd8 elite overcome small phone shortcomings like poorer heat dissipation small battery not fps seems smoother maxed graphics compared last gen flagship phones s25 still heat quickly unles lower graphic settings demanding games results thermal throttling would say overall gaming experience perhaps slightly better big screen welcoled sd8gen3 phone power efficient also means 40mah feels like 50mah sd8gen3 phone definitely nowhere near current gen monsters sd8elite 60mah selling point s25 probable size weight unmatched smaller lighter bit s24 iphone 16 one round smaller supposed mini phones like xiaomi 15 vivo x20 pro mini still got appeal screen wise like suspect earlier testing many phone trigger point low frequency pwm low brightness high frequency pwm normal brightness like iqo phones tend like use 2160hz pwm dimming sounds nice paper higher brightness super triggering within seconds feel strain eyes 480hz pwm actually ended okay set brightness level high enough hard explain words low way screen behave cause noticeable eyestrain combat using extra dim option comes issues eventually gave phone also got things less samsung rather googles ap lol

Message:
Ordered on 1 Feb the Titanium Jetblack, order delivery is stated as 19 Feb.

CS operator kept apologising but said there was little she can do, except for escalating to their CS specialists.
FYI.

Message:
Long time iOS user shifting to S25U for my first Android experience.
WhatsApp, Telegram, notes, contacts, calendar, emails, photo data transfer from iOS to S25U was a breeze.
What I found challenging is transferring payment systems (banks and debit/credit card apps) to Android. After many years of using FaceID with iOS, I realized I don't remember a lot of my passwords because of the super convenience of just relying on FaceID. So there were a few times I was forced to press "Forgot Password" to shift to S25U. Perhaps some of the experts here can give some guidance and advise how to make this less painful.
Also, while WhatsApp and Telegram were easy, for Viber looks like there is no simple way to do it other than backing the chats up in PC, installing mediation apps, then loading up to S25U. Anyone of you did an easier way of migrating Viber chats to S25/U?
Would really appreciate.
Cleaned_Message: long time ios user shifting s25u first android experience whatsap telegram notes contacts calendar emails photo data transfer ios s25u breeze found challenging transferring payment systems banks debitcredit card aps android many years using faceid ios realized not remember lot passwords super convenience relying faceid times forced press forgot password shift s25u perhaps experts give guidance advise make less painful also whatsap telegram easy viber looks like no simple way backing chats pc installing mediation aps loading s25u anyone easier way migrating viber chats s25u would really appreciate

Message: A hardware sound coming from a Samsung phone, especially a slight rattling noise when shaking the device, is usually caused by the phone's Optical Image Stabilization (OIS) feature, which is a normal function and not a defect; the small components inside the camera lens can move slightly when the phone is not actively taking pictures, creating a minor rattling sound.

do you have many bank apps? this is a chance for u to change all your app passwords to something you can remember and use across the apps. if the bank app allows Singpass login, use it so that you don't need to reset your password. eg ocbc and trust.

Message:
Just a simple write up after relluisng s25u for a while.
Ordered on 28th Jan 2/3pm when Citi bank promo just went out, else should be the best deal or better deals for 1tb jet black. Also ordered 1tb jet black from shopee but I cancelled that since I will only be back on 7th Feb. Too troublesome.
Phone delivery was on 6th but push to 7th since no one home. Actually doesn't matter since I actually landed on 8th.
Smart switch transfer is easy and I was shocked to drain all s25u battery. Checked the battery and transfer history and lucky everything was completed.
Didn't have time to fully transfer, so used 2 phones for a week. There are so many manual signing in and updating of app that it took like 2 full days! Very irritating. Not sure what happened to auto updates.
Then compasia scheduled to trade in on 17th. Everything was smooth and I didn't remove sp or camera lens. $605 approved and 180 is from Samsung site. I checked other trade in price is around 800. So very comparable and save on transport and able to fix trade in price since 28th Jan is very nice. Maybe if sell direct, can earn another 100 plus but I think not bad la.
I tried using Samsung standing case, not too bad but just no magsafe. I ordered Magbak case which has everything for around sgd100. That should be my main case. Likely will sell samsung case for cheap.
Samsung sp feels good.
For transport, not sure what I did but it is still the same. Just tap at reader and it works without needing any unlocking.
Cleaned_Message: simple write reluisng s25u ordered 28th jan 23pm citi bank promo went else best deal better deals 1tb jet black also ordered 1tb jet black shope cancelled since back 7th feb troublesome phone delivery 6th push 7th since no one home actually not matter since actually landed 8th smart switch transfer easy shocked drain s25u battery checked battery transfer history lucky everything completed not time fully transfer used 2 phones week many manual signing updating ap took like 2 full days irritating not sure happened auto updates compasia scheduled trade 17th everything smooth not remove sp camera lens 605 approved 180 samsung site checked trade price around 80 comparable save transport able fix trade price since 28th jan nice maybe sell direct earn another 100 plus think not bad la tried using samsung standing case not bad no magsafe ordered magbak case everything around sgd10 main case likely sell samsung case cheap samsung sp feels good transport not sure still tap reader works without needing unlocking

Message:
So far been a couple of days using the S25 Ultra.
Battery life to me has been remarkably better than my S23 on both light profile because I am only using it as a work phone. Camera's seems a marginal improvement but I have not played much with the cameras so far.
Speakers are tremendously good and a notable upgrade over the S23. The other thing I realised is that during charging, the phone is no where as warm as the S23 Ultra on Super Fast Charging 2.0. S23 Ultra would be noticeably warm just before pulling out of the charger but the S25 Ultra remains generally cool and just a hint of warmth which is in no way even comparable to S23 Ultra. To me, these upgrades seems a worthwhile upgrade especially with the overtrade on launch day. Only paid around 700 bucks with vouchers and offsetting Samsung points + overtrade my S23 Ultra.
Cleaned_Message: far couple days using s25 ultra battery life remarkably better s23 light profile using work phone cameras seems marginal improvement not played much cameras far speakers tremendously good notable upgrade s23 thing realised charging phone no warm s23 ultra super fast charging 20 s23 ultra would noticeably warm pulling charger s25 ultra remains generally cool hint warmth no way even comparable s23 ultra upgrades seems worthwhile upgrade especially overtrade launch day paid around 70 bucks vouchers offsetting samsung points overtrade s23 ultra

Message: The problem i have is this kind of test usually not that conclusive. By the time the test completes, new batt tech or new ways to improve battery charging likely exist, so the conclusion will be based on old devices. At the end of the day, general advice is dont stress over how to charge battery. Batteries these days, unless stress your battery and use in an abnormal way, likely most will change phone faster than battery spoil. Battery sure will drop over time, so i think the point is, whether charge 20-80, or always fast recharge, do what that it suits you.

Message:
Not using it but went to play around with it in the Samsung physical store.
Kindsuit is fake leather. Should be polyurethane plastic material. It does not feel cheap like taobao fake leather cases, but durability seems like an unknown at this point. It's too expensive at retail price, imo. Poor value compared to 3rd party case brands.
Silicone case is nice to hold and touch. Reminds me of the Apple silicone cases. May have the problem where the silicone tends to 'stick' on the inside of your pockets.
Side note:
Installed the SC+ complimentary AR film screen protector at Samsung service centre
Big con is that the AR film is definitely more reflective than the glass screen, although still more AR than any standard non-AR tempered glass. I used the S25 ultra for a full week without any SP so the AR visual reference in my memory is still strong.
Just too bad the AR SP couldn't retain the same level of AR as the naked screen
Cleaned_Message: not using went play around samsung physical store kindsuit fake leather polyurethane plastic material not feel cheap like taobao fake leather cases durability seems like unknown point expensive retail price imo poor value compared 3rd party case brands silicone case nice hold touch reminds apple silicone cases may problem silicone tends stick inside pockets side note installed sc complimentary ar film screen protector samsung service centre big con ar film definitely reflective glass screen although still ar standard nonar tempered glass used s25 ultra full week without sp ar visual reference memory still strong bad ar sp could not retain level ar naked screen

Message:
Just sharing my S23U upgrade journey to S25U -
PC dream just confirmed trade in value on my S23U 512gb of $792.
Total damage for S25U ~ $1469.20 ($1828-$182.80-$38-$88-$50) - $73.46 (shopback) - $792 = $603.74
If I had chosen trade in during preorder, comp asia only offer $685 ($505 base + $180 overtrade) for S23U. In addition, 1st time samsung app purchase of 10% off will be $114.30 (10% of $1828 - $685) instead of  $182.80. Those that selected trade in during preorder will lugi trade in price of $175.50 ($792 - $685 + $68.5)!
Cleaned_Message: sharing s23u upgrade journey s25u pc dream confirmed trade value s23u 512gb 792 total damage s25u 146920 1828182803850 7346 shopback 792 60374 chosen trade preorder comp asia offer 685 505 base 180 overtrade s23u addition 1st time samsung ap purchase 10 1430 10 1828 685 instead 18280 selected trade preorder lugi trade price 1750 792 685 685

Message:
Google’s two new system services are focused on providing advanced security features and are highly advantageous, where the Android Key Verifier is for developers that significantly allow them to store keys that are end-to-end encrypted while also keeping an eye that users must use the right keys when communicating. In other words, it’s basically a contact key verification feature.
Alternatively, the other system service, Android System SafetyCore, certainly provides more improved security features for Android smartphones. This system service further plays a key role in controlling sensitive content by offering a warning in
.
Moreover, Google has already installed these system services on Android devices with the devices running versions that are listed above; it’s obvious that compatible
Galaxy devices will get these functions that will aim to improve and increase the device’s security, though.

Message:
Ok I think I've settled down on the tempered glass and case for my s25. Tempered glass using the whitestone dome anti-reflection non glue type, the anti reflection is pretty good, makes the s25 screen much less reflective since the glass of the s25 don't have armour glass like the ultra. Fingerprint sensing is also instantaneous.
Case I got a cheap $10 black silicon case from mister mobile when I bought my phone, expected to use it as a temp case since I thought so cheap can't be good. It's unexpectedly very good, the case provides just the right amount of grip while not being too grippy when fishing the phone out of the pocket. It's also quite svelte and not bulky at all, and has a lanyard hole. Cutouts are smooth and precise as well.
Cleaned_Message: ok think settled tempered glass case s25 tempered glass using whitestone dome antireflection non glue type anti reflection pretty good makes s25 screen much less reflective since glass s25 not armour glass like ultra fingerprint sensing also instantaneous case got cheap 10 black silicon case mister mobile bought phone expected use temp case since thought cheap not good unexpectedly good case provides right amount grip not gripy fishing phone pocket also quite svelte not bulky lanyard hole cutouts smooth precise well

Message:
Updating now.
I can understand your disappointment but some of these faults were already made known.
SPen downgrade was widely publicised.  I hesitated to get the S25U because of this.
Camera ring is glued.   Also no surprise as the tear down videos already highlighted it.
Google pay / Samsung pay not working properly.   For me it has been flawless.  No issues so far especially with Samsung pay.
My disappointment is that the cameras are not as great as I hoped.   I just came from the Find x8 Pro which IMHO are better than the S25U.   Perhaps future updates would improve the camera.
However I've always preferred one Ui to color os.  I love the perfectly flat screen and the way the S25U feels in my hand. The AI is superior to most phones and I'm having a lot of fun with it.
The fingerprint sensor also has been improved and detection is about 95% with tempered glass.
My Find x8 Pro has already been sold.
For me,  no regrets getting the S25U.
Cleaned_Message: updating understand disappointment faults already made known spen downgrade widely publicised hesitated get s25u camera ring glued also no surprise tear videos already highlighted google pay samsung pay not working properly flawless no issues far especially samsung pay disappointment cameras not great hoped came find x8 pro imho better s25u perhaps future updates would improve camera however always preferred one ui color os love perfectly flat screen way s25u feels hand ai superior phones lot fun fingerprint sensor also improved detection 95 tempered glass find x8 pro already sold no regrets getting s25u

Message:
hmm, i don't know whether i've been spoilt over the last few years.
The last android phone i was impressed with was the huawei mate 20 pro. the speed, battery life, everything was awesome until trump came into the picture.
then i switched to flip 1, fold 3, fold 5. all gave me a certain sense of excitement. disappointment about the battery life and longetivity but still made me excited.
s25u... i was excited to have battery life that would last the whole day, a spen that would fit in the phone instead of having to get a bulky case on top of a bulky phone for the fold series.
but battery life turns out to be... only about 30-40% better than the fold 5 so far. screen is smaller and didn't made me excited. speed is fast but that will filter down to the fold 7 eventually later this year.
so i guess i may have gotten a byd atto 3 instead of a tesla like i've imagined. reliable, relatively modern. but nothing groundbreaking or market leading. Guess I miss the samsung of the 90s and early 2000s where they dared to innovate and push boundaries. Now only the china companies are pushing out near 100w charging, near 6000 mah batteries albeit with poorer software optimizations.
if the RRP was 1.8k, it would be worth it. but for a rrp of nearly 2.4k, it is underwhelming. Give me better hardware! AI features should be standard for all with UI 7 or Android 15.
But with all that is said, one ui 7 is certainly an improvement and a stable for folks who need a reputatable brand to comply with corporate mdm policies. if the china company could fix their software and reputations then i would leave samsung in the dust too.

Message:
Came across this tip/trick on Reddit. I tried it and it is working so much better now. When registering your finger/thumb. Do alternate.
1st scan) right thumb
2nd) left thumb
3rd) right
4th) left
Repeat until the setup is completed.
Doesn't make sense but now when with dry thumb, I can unlock relatively easier than before. I had 3 scans of the same right thumb previously and still having intermittent unlock issues with dry thumb.
Finally no need to lick my finger/thumb to unlock.  So happy!
Cleaned_Message: came across tiptrick redit tried working much better registering fingerthumb alternate 1st scan right thumb 2nd left thumb 3rd right 4th left repeat setup completed not make sense dry thumb unlock relatively easier 3 scans right thumb previously still intermittent unlock issues dry thumb finally no need lick fingerthumb unlock happy
